movies.title: The Cavern
movies.plot: 8 explorers trapped in a Russian cave system are hunted by an unknown presence.
movies.simplePlot: 8 explorers trapped in a Russian cave system are hunted by an unknown presence.

biography.bio: Sybil Temchen was born to French parents and spent her early childhood living in both France and the U.S. She started acting at a young age in school plays and was the youngest member, at age 7, of her local theater repertory company. Temchen went on to major in acting in college. She began acting professionally not long after in theater, film, and television starring alongside such notable actors as Helen Mirren, Adrien Brody, Simon Baker, and others. She has also starred in projects with such directors and producers as Matt Reeves (Dawn of the Planet of the Apes), Steven Bochco (Murder in the First), Michael Apted (Masters of Sex), and just starred in the 2014 indie hit Audrey (which she also co-wrote and produced) for which she has now been dubbed the "Jack Bauer of Romantic Comedies" by The Examiner. Temchen has also produced and written one short and produced one other feature film.
biography.name: Sybil Darrow

biography.bio: Mustafa Shakir is an actor and writer, known for The Cavern (2005), The Stream (2015) and Geezas (2011).
biography.name: Mustafa Shakir

biography.bio: Ogy Durham is known for her work on The Cavern (2005), In2ition (2008) and Urban Playground (2002).
biography.name: Ogy Durham

biography.bio: Andrew Caple-Shaw was born on January 8, 1980 in Fort Worth, Texas, USA as Andrew Caple Shaw. He is an actor, known for First Daughter (2004), The Cavern (2005) and L.A. Noire (2011).
biography.name: Andrew Caple-Shaw

biography.bio: Danny Jacobs is an award winning, Los Angeles based actor and filmmaker. Alongside his writer and directing partner, Darren Grodsky, Danny made his debut narrative feature with Humboldt County. The film stars Chris Messina (Julie and Julia, Away We Go), Frances Conroy (Six Feet Under), Fairuza Balk (The Craft), Brad Dourif (Lord of the Rings), Peter Bogdanovich (The Last Picture Show) and Jeremy Strong (Lincoln), and was an official selection in the 2008 SXSW Film Festival. Additionally, the film won the audience award at the Idaho International Film Festival as well as the Ibiza International Film Festival. Magnolia Pictures released the film theatrically in 2008. As an actor Danny starred alongside Harland Williams (Dumb and Dumber) and Greg Pitts (Office Space) in Fox's Bachelor Party 2: The Last Temptation, a sequel to the 1980s hit with Tom Hanks. Additionally, Danny played a lead role in Sony Pictures' The Cavern, directed by Olatunde Onsunsamni (The Fourth Kind). Danny's TV credits include guest-starring stints on The West Wing, NCIS: Los Angeles, and NBC's prime time comedy, Love Bites. Danny earned a B.A. in International Relations from Stanford University.
biography.name: Danny Jacobs

biography.bio: The son of two school teachers, Andres grew up both in urban East Los Angeles and suburban San Diego. His exposure to gangs and the turbulent urban life of East L.A. at an early age prompted him to seek to become a role model in the Latino community. After obtaining his MFA in acting from NYU, he became the first male (on the Mexican side of his family) to hold a post-graduate degree, something he is very proud of. Outside of his Film/TV work, he is an active member of several non-profit community organizations dedicated to utilizing the arts to help inner-city (primarily Latino) youth in Los Angeles learn non-violent conflict resolution, language development, and public speaking skills.
biography.name: Andres Hudson

biography.bio: Johnnie Colter is known for his work on The Cavern (2005), Bigfoot County (2012) and Another Round (2009).
biography.name: Johnnie Colter
